etymology.description: Depicts a coil of silk thread
etymology.interpretation: The character 糸(mì, 'silk thread') visually represents a bundle or coil of silk threads, aligning with its meaning of thread or textile.

examples.chinese: 古人用糸制作衣物(古人用糸製作衣物)。
examples.english: Ancient people used silk thread to make clothes.

examples.chinese: 他用糸织成精致的布料(他用糸織成精緻的布料)，装饰了贵族的衣裳(裝飾了貴族的衣裳)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng mì zhīchéng jīngzhì de bùliào, zhuāngshì le guìzú de yīshang.
examples.english: He wove exquisite fabric with silk thread, decorating the robes of nobles.
